newsitem.title: USA: American Medcare to merge into InfoCure.
newsitem.headline: American Medcare to merge into InfoCure.

text.p: American Medcare Corp said Thursday it signed a letter of intent to merge into InfoCure Corp.
The company said InfoCure will exchange about 3.3 million shares of its common stock for all of the issued and outstanding stock of American Medcare.
It said the merger would occur in the first quarter of 1997 when InfoCure makes its initial public offering.
InfoCure was formed by executives of American Medcare to make acquisitions of certain practice management system businesses.
American said a wholly owned subsidiary acquired the assets of the healthcare division of Info Systems Inc, headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina.
The division markets practice management systems to mid- and large-sized medical practices and clinics, it said.
The aggregate consideration consisted of $150,000 in cash and a promissory note of $1.6 million, it added.

American also said it had signed a letter of intent with Atlanta-based Millard-Wayne Inc to acquire all of its outstanding capital stock for cash and common stock. Millard-Wayne is in the same business as Info Systems.
American Medcare is a supplier of practice management software and services to health care providers.
